{"step_by_step_thinking": "Expansion screws are used in orthodontics to widen the upper jaw. The amount of expansion is controlled by the number of turns or degrees the screw is turned. Generally, a 90° turn of an expansion screw results in a 0.25 mm expansion. However, this can vary depending on the specific design of the screw. Looking at the options provided, the closest to this general rule is 0.20 mm.", "answer_choice": "A"}
